intro.title: Who We Are
intro.text: SGFF is dedicated to environmental and climate education, empowering the next generation to build resilient, environmentally harmonious communities.

highlights.title: Youth Empowerment
highlights.description: Building leaders for climate action and sustainability.

highlights.title: Circular Economy
highlights.description: Promoting waste reduction and sustainable resources.

highlights.title: Community Engagement
highlights.description: Working together for a greener future.

story.title: Our Story
story.content: Founded in early 2023 by Mr. Godfred Owusu, with support from Mr. Francis Amoako, Mr. Felix Owusu, and Mr. Jeff Addo Donkor. Initially starting as the 'Youth Planner and Environment Association–KNUST', the organization collaborated with Dr. Stephen Takyi under the Ghana Association of Student Planners. It transitioned to the 'Sustainable Green Future Club' before officially registering in mid-2025 as a national non-profit: Sustainable Green Future Foundation (SGFF).

mission.title: Mission
mission.content: To empower young people and communities for climate action, promote circular economy principles, encourage waste reduction, and build resilient, environmentally harmonious communities.

vision.title: Vision
vision.content: A world where communities and emerging leaders actively promote environmental sustainability, achieving harmony between humanity and the environment.

items.title: Environmental & Climate Education
items.description: Comprehensive education initiatives designed to raise awareness about climate change and environmental protection.

items.title: Youth Empowerment & Leadership
items.description: Training programs to develop the next generation of environmental leaders and advocates.

items.title: Circular Economy Awareness
items.description: Workshops and campaigns focusing on the principles of a circular economy to reduce waste.

items.title: Community Sustainability Advocacy
items.description: Grassroots advocacy to implement sustainable practices at the local community level.

items.title: Waste Reduction Initiatives
items.description: Practical projects aimed at responsible waste management and environmental responsibility.

impact.title: Our Impact
impact.content: SGFF has made significant strides in education and awareness. By engaging youth and communities, we are driving a cultural shift towards sustainability. Following our registration as a national non-profit, our scope has expanded to influence environmental practices across Ghana, fostering a generation that is conscious of their ecological footprint.

challenges.title: Challenges Faced
items: Scaling activities effectively during the registration process.

keyLearnings.title: Key Learnings
items: Collaboration is essential for meaningful impact.
Youth are powerful drivers of environmental change.
Institutional support is crucial for strengthening sustainability efforts.

getInvolved.title: Get Involved
getInvolved.content: We invite individuals and organizations to join us in our mission. While we are currently in an informational phase, future opportunities will include volunteering, strategic partnerships, and sponsorship. Your support is vital to building a sustainable green future.
getInvolved.cta: Stay tuned for upcoming opportunities to contribute.
